triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: Twitter is the primary social media platform being analyzed for predicting message propagation through retweets.

triples.name: Tweet (social media)
triples.relevance: Tweets are the fundamental data units analyzed in this research for predicting retweeting behavior.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is the core methodology used to automatically predict whether tweets will be retweeted.

triples.name: Online machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a passive-aggressive online learning approach, a form of online machine learning for real-time prediction.

triples.name: Document classification
triples.relevance: Tweet classification (determining if a tweet will be retweeted) is a text classification problem related to document classification.

triples.name: Social network analysis
triples.relevance: Social network features are extracted and analyzed to predict retweet propagation in the Twitter social network.

triples.name: Prediction
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the core task of predicting whether a tweet will be retweeted based on its features.

triples.name: Supervised learning
triples.relevance: The paper uses supervised learning with labeled tweets to train the passive-aggressive classifier.
